And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.
And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

verses.text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

similars.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

similars.text: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.
After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

verses.text: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it.
But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.
And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

similars.text: But when they in their trouble did turn unto the Lord God of Israel, and sought him, he was found of them.
When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.
And them that are turned back from the Lord; and those that have not sought the Lord, nor inquired for him.
And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.

verses.text: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.
And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

similars.text: And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at his doctrine.
The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at his doctrine.
And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

verses.text: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

similars.text: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!
And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, Is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.
And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.
Who said unto his father and to his mother, I have not seen him; neither did he acknowledge his brethren, nor knew his own children: for they have observed thy word, and kept thy covenant.
But behold, my father and I have seen them, and they have ministered unto us.
And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

And thou didst hear me because of mine afflictions and my sincerity; and it is because of thy Son that thou hast been thus merciful unto me, therefore I will cry unto thee in all mine afflictions, for in thee is my joy; for thou hast turned thy judgments away from me, because of thy Son.

verses.text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?

similars.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them, for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of before ye ask him.
Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
And said unto them, I see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.
Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.

verses.text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

similars.text: And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.
But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.
And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
Now they understood not the words which they spake; for they knew not that the earth should pass away.
And he said: Go and tell this people--Hear ye indeed, but they understood not; and see ye indeed, but they perceived not.
But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
And he spake this parable unto them, saying,
And so great was their astonishment, that they fell to the earth, and understood not the words which he spake unto them.
And it came to pass that the Lord spake unto them saying:
And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

And the man said unto him: We do not believe that thou knowest any such thing. We do not believe in these foolish traditions. We do not believe that thou knowest of things to come, neither do we believe that thy fathers and also that our fathers did know concerning the things which they spake, of that which is to come.
And they understood me not, for they supposed it had been the Gentiles; for they understood not that the Gentiles should be converted through their preaching.

For he truly spake many great things unto them, which were hard to be understood, save a man should inquire of the Lord; and they being hard in their hearts, therefore they did not look unto the Lord as they ought.
And it was forbidden them that they should utter; neither was it given unto them power that they could utter the things which they saw and heard;
And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.
They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
And so great was their astonishment, that they fell to the earth, and understood not the words which he spake unto them.
And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
Now they understood not the words which they spake; for they knew not that the earth should pass away.
But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.
This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.
And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.
And it came to pass that again they heard the voice, and they understood it not.
And it came to pass as he began to expound these things unto them they were angry with him, and began to mock him; and they would not hear the words which he spake.

verses.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

similars.text: And his mother's brethren spake of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

similars.text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.
But the word of God grew and multiplied.
So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me.
And the child Samuel grew on, and was in favour both with the Lord, and also with men.
And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
